subject: Real Estate
title: Fractional Ownership Goes Digital
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Fractional Ownership Goes Digital.

hook.text: Buying property has always required big money. Platforms now let you invest as little as $50 in a building.

buildup.text: Companies tokenize properties into digital shares. Investors earn rental income proportional to their stake.

discovery.text: A warehouse in Texas or an apartment in Berlin can have thousands of micro-owners across the globe.

twist.text: Liquidity is still a problem. Selling your tiny share isn't as easy as selling a stock.

climax.text: If secondary markets mature, fractional ownership could democratize real estate like ETFs did for stocks.

punchline.text: Fifty dollars can buy a piece of a building now.

quiz.question: What is fractional real estate ownership?
options: Buying small digital shares of a property
